+1 for Screenflow
http://screenr.com Web-based screencasts. Just click record. (Disclosure, I'm the CEO.)
Screenflow is great but expensive.

If you're asking which is the best, it really depends on your criteria or conditions of satisfaction. I've used all of them. Screenr.com: fast, easy, 5min cap, HD output & mp4 download, tweet-friendly, free, dig it! Gr8 app, Adam. // Screenflow: paid app, clean UI, EZ 2 use, record desktop motion+webcam video+VO, EZ 2 edit etc, I've even used it just for newscast-style videos as it was so easy to cut from "talking-head" to B-roll. Current favorite for screencasts needing more time than 5 min or editing of additional layers of video/audio/titling/call-outs etc. // Jing (PC&Mac): Free, EZ 2 use, dig it for fast upload to free 2Gb hosting account, then share wherever; can be private as compared to Screenr (all public). Dig it too. // Camtasia (Mac): cut my teeth on Camtasia for PC before I left the "dark side"; demo'd the Mac version a couple months back; the UI is somewhat easy to work with, and seems to include some features not in Screenflow. // All the above tools are good, and based on your project & budget, some will satisfy you, some won't make the cut :-) Hope this helps!
